qas.question: Who was the first President to address the NAACP?
How many people were present at the speech that Truman made?
Where did Truman's historic speech take place?
During the speech, Truman made the statement that each man should be guaranteed what?
Who's authority did Truman want to increase throughout the states?
Who was the first President to address the NICP?
How many people left the speech that Truman made?
Where did Truman's historic speech end?
During the speech, Truman made the statement that each man shouldn't be guaranteed what?
Who's authority did Truman want to decrease throughout the states?

context: In June, <a0_0><b5_0>Truman<b5_0/><a0_0/> became the first president to address the NAACP. His speech was a significant departure from traditional race relations in the United States. In front of <a1_0><b6_0>10,000<b6_0/><a1_0/> people at the <a2_0><b7_0>Lincoln Memorial<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the president left no doubt where he stood on civil rights. According to his speech, America had "reached a turning point in the long history of our country's efforts to guarantee freedom and <b8_0>equality<b8_0/> to all our citizens…Each man must be guaranteed <a3_0>equality of opportunity<a3_0/>." He proposed what black citizens had been calling for - an enhanced role of <a4_0><b9_0>federal<b9_0/><a4_0/> authority through the states. "We must make the Federal government a friendly, vigilant defender of the rights and equalities of all Americans. And again I mean all Americans.":40
